hanzi-su-wiki:
町

Значения

Тё — мера длины 109,09 м; небольшой город, улица, квартал

Мнемоника

  • Прямые насыпи между рисовыми полями 田, по которым разрешено ходить солдатам 丁. Единица длины поля, равная 15000 китайским футам. Позже — улица, квартал, небольшой город.

  • Рисовое поле и дорога к городу.

Варианты

甼
purpleculture_pinyin:
dīng
(used in place names)
(используется в названиях мест)

tǐng
raised path between fields
поднятый путь между полями
rtega_mnemonic:
町町RS
X		town
  • concentration of houses 丁 with rice fields 田 all around
 街

町町RStown, village, block, street, raised path between fields
  • streets 丁 surrounded by fields 田 (not by trees 村)
 街
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 丁 indicates the sound; 田 (field) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
畹町 [ wǎn dīng ]: Wanding town Dehong Dai and Jingpo autonomous prefecture 德宏傣族景颇族自治州 , Yunnan, on border with Myanmar (Burma)
畹町市 [ wǎn dīng shì ]: Wanding town Dehong Dai and Jingpo autonomous prefecture 德宏傣族景颇族自治州 , Yunnan, on border with Myanmar (Burma)
西门町 [ xī mén dīng ]: Ximending (neighborhood in Wanhua district, Taipei)
大麦町 [ dà mài tǐng ]: Dalmatian (dog breed)
室町 [ shì tǐng ]: Muromachi bakufu, the feudal government of Japan (1338-1573) under the Ashikaga shoguns
室町幕府 [ shì tǐng mù fǔ ]: Muromachi bakufu, the feudal government of Japan (1338-1573) under the Ashikaga shoguns
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 田 [ tián ] field, farm, arable land; cultivated
    • 丁 [ dīng ] male adult; robust, vigorous; 4th heavenly stem
heisig_constituent: village, rice field, brains, street, nail, spike
heisig_story: Street signs standing at the corner of the rice fields depict the village limits. (Remember what was said earlier: when used as a primitive, a kanji may either take its primitive meaning or revert to the original meaning of its key word.)
koohiiStory1: Actually this means town, like one that has lots of streets and is surrounded by all the rice fields.
koohiiStory2: Getting this one confused with Town is easy, so remember it with this rhyme. "Pillage the village, for the rice and and the tea." the street primitive on the right looks like a ´t´.
jp_example_words:
下町(したまち): Shitamachi, lower parts of town
町(まち): town, street, road
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: When you see both a rice paddy and a street in the same place, you have the makings of a whole town!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Think about it, a single farm wouldn't need a whole street. Just paths would do. There is a street next to this rice paddy, so there must be other people, which makes this a town.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You go to visit this nice little town. But then, there she is... Every time you walk down the street, the street-woman Mrs. Chou (ちょう) arrives to ruin your day.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Remember imagining Mrs. Chou in great detail in level 2? Time for some of that work to come to fruition. Imagine Mrs. Chou walking down the street of the town towards you, ready to make your day bad. She breaks things as she walks towards you, then knocks you down for walking around in her town. She says, "Wherever there's a street, you'll find Mrs. Chou." Then spits on your back as she walks away.

Kanshudo_mnemonic: a block (丁) of rice fields (田) became the town

町字的基本解释

町
tǐng
〔町町〕平坦的样子。
田界田间小路：町畦（田埂，喻界限、规矩、约束）。町疃（田舍旁的空地）。

町
dīng
〔畹町〕见“

町字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tǐng］［tīng］
［《廣韻》他鼎切，上迥，透。］
［《廣韻》徒鼎切，上迥，定。］
［《廣韻》他丁切，平青，透。］
亦作“甼1”。
(1)田界；田间小路。参见“町畦”。
(2)田亩；田地。
(3)古代地积单位名。
[②]［zhèng］
［《集韻》丈梗切，上梗，澄。］
亦作“圢1”。
平地。
[③]［tiǎn］
［《廣韻》他典切，上銑，透。］
见“町3畽”。
[④]［dīng］
地名用字。云南省德宏傣族景颇族自治州有畹町镇。

町字的康熙字典解释

【午集上】【田字部】　町； 康熙笔画：7； 页码：页759第07
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】?他頂切，音珽。【說文】田踐處曰町。【廣韻】田區畔埒也。【詩·鄭風·東門之墠傳】墠，除地町町者。【左傳·襄二十五年】町原防。【註】隄防閒地，不得方正如井田，別爲小頃町也。　又國名。【前漢·武帝紀】鉤町侯。【註】町，音若挺，西南夷也。　又縣名。【前漢·地理志】句町縣。【註】音劬挺。　又盢町，山名。【後漢·郡國志】益州郡盢町山，出銀鉛。　又【廣韻】【正韻】徒鼎切【集韻】待鼎切，?音挺。【莊子·人閒世】彼且爲無町畦，亦與之爲無町畦。【註】町，徒頂反。畦，戸圭反。畔垺也。無畔垺，無威儀也。　又【集韻】湯丁切，音聽。義同。　又都挺切，音頂。田畝謂之町。　又丈梗切，音瑒。町，除地爲墠也。　又【五音集韻】他典切，音腆。町畽，鹿跡。【詩·豳風】町畽鹿場。【傳】町畽，鹿迹也。【釋文】町，他典反。又他頂反。【朱註】町畽，舍旁隙地也。　【集韻】或作圢䵺。

町字的源字形

小篆楷体

町字的起名意思

田界；田间小路。

Name meaning
Field boundary; field path.
dīng, tǐng
I dīng
1) улица; квартал (в названиях)
2) яп. посёлок; небольшой город
II tǐng
1) межа
2) пахотная земля, поля
3) яп. тё (японская мера длины ― 109,09 м, и поверхности ― 0,9917 га)

町

Значения

Тё — мера длины 109,09 м; небольшой город, улица, квартал

Мнемоника

  • Прямые насыпи между рисовыми полями 田, по которым разрешено ходить солдатам 丁. Единица длины поля, равная 15000 китайским футам. Позже — улица, квартал, небольшой город.

  • Рисовое поле и дорога к городу.

Варианты

甼

Radicals: 田, 丁  (rice-paddy, street)
Meaning Mnemonic
When you see both a rice paddy and a street in the same place, you have the makings of a whole town!
Think about it, a single farm wouldn't need a whole street. Just paths would do. There is a street next to this rice paddy, so there must be other people, which makes this a town.
Reading Mnemonic
You go to visit this nice little town. But then, there she is... Every time you walk down the street, the street-woman Mrs. Chou (ちょう) arrives to ruin your day.
Remember imagining Mrs. Chou in great detail in level 2? Time for some of that work to come to fruition. Imagine Mrs. Chou walking down the street of the town towards you, ready to make your day bad. She breaks things as she walks towards you, then knocks you down for walking around in her town. She says, "Wherever there's a street, you'll find Mrs. Chou." Then spits on your back as she walks away.
